contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox VG | title = X-Men : Mojo World | image = [[File:X-menmojoworld.jpg|frameless|X-Men Mojo World]] | caption = Cover art <small>(Game Gear)</small> | developer = Sega | publisher = [[Sega]] | designer = Jerry Markota | composer = Paul Hutchinson | released = '''Game Gear:''' {{vgrelease|NA=1996<ref>[http://www.gamefaqs.com/gamegear/586868-x-men-mojo-world/data ''X-Men: Mojo World'' (Game Gear)] at [[GameFAQs]]</ref>}} '''Master System:''' {{vgrelease new|BRA|1996<ref>[http://www.gamefaqs.com/sms/932777-x-men-mojo-world/data ''X-Men: Mojo World'' (Master System)] at [[GameFAQs]]</ref>}} | genre = [[Action game|Action]] | modes = [[Single player]] | platforms = [[Sega Game Gear]], [[Sega Master System]] | media = Game Gear [[Cartridge (electronics)|Cartridge]] }} '''''X-Men : Mojo World''''' is a video game released in 1996 on the [[Sega Game Gear]] system. The game starts off with Wolverine and Rogue as playable X-Men; Gambit, Cyclops, Havok, and Shard can be unlocked later on. The game shares the same engine as its predecessor, ''[[X-Men: Gamesmaster's Legacy]]''. The game was also released for the [[Sega Master System]] in Brazil by [[Tec Toy]]. == Storyline == [[Spiral (comics)|Spiral]], a beautiful, six-armed television producer and denizen of [[Mojo (comics)|Mojo World]], pits the X-Men against their all-time toughest foes in the ultimate televised slugfest, ''"The Greatest Battles of the X-Men"''! If her scheme works, the citizens of Mojo World will tune-in and she will become their new ruler. ===Playable characters=== The character lineup for the game includes [[Wolverine (comics)|Wolverine]], [[Rogue (comics)|Rogue]], [[Gambit (comics)|Gambit]], [[Cyclops (comics)|Cyclops]], [[Havok (comics)|Havok]], and [[Shard (comics)|Shard]]. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.mobygames.com/game/x-men-mojo-world ''X-Men: Mojo World''] at [[MobyGames]] {{X-Men media}} [[Category:1996 video games]] [[Category:Sega video games]] [[Category:Game Gear games]] [[Category:Platform games]] [[Category:Side-scrolling video games]] [[Category:Sega Master System games]] [[Category:Video games based on X-Men]] {{Action-videogame-stub}}
